text.2: These bouncy critters can be found all over the Savanna. They can usually be found munching on Sawgrass with their tough, flat teeth.
text.3: It's not clear whether these creatures are made of tar or simply covered in tar. Whatever it is, they're extremely sticky, and they don't seem too happy about it.
text.1: Hovering, three-tentacled cephalopods that make their homes in mud. The Glidopi seem to have an internal beak deep inside their bodies, used to grind food.
text.11: Although it has a terrible diet, the Bamli seems to be in perfect shape, likely due to its ability to plug into the Bawg and siphon energy into itself. It may also have something to do with its amazing moustache.
text.9: Known as the most awkward of creatures, the Satgat hides behind its pointy hat to make sure nobody sees its puzzled expression.
text.15: Lyffs never evolved to have skulls, so they instead evolved the ability to instantly grow exploding ice shards around their brains. This was a much more complicated solution, but nature isn't perfect.
text.13: By harnessing the electromagnetic field of the planet, Glasers can rub atoms together with their antlers to produce a powerful laser. They can also rub sticks together to make fire, but it's way less impressive.
text.5: Zugs are so lazy that they try to avoid moving as much as possible. Because of this, their bodies are packed with a neverending supply of electricity, leftover from their normal metabolic processes.
text.4: These little bat-like creatures group together into packs and then viciously swarm anything that comes near. But they're super nice once you get to know them.
text.7: The long, slender tendrils of the Throak can maneuver expertly through the Bawg's system of pores, cleaning them of debris and parasites.
text.6: Vommas have such a powerful self-preservation instinct that they happily sacrifice their tadpole babies to save themselves. It's okay, though... they generate new babies every few seconds.
text.18: This friendly little guy becomes horribly enraged when confronted by anything at all. Very hard to housebreak.
text.0: These glowing, gigantic insects seem to only come out at night. Their carapace is extremely tough, and they seem generally angry about most things.
text.10: Is it a worm? Is it a squid? Is it a flower? Yes. It likes to spend a lot of time underground, eating hair follicle roots.
text.8: Snorbles are incredibly loud creatures when provoked, but really they just like settling down and reading a good book.
text.14: This narcissistic snail-like creature can move so fast it becomes a blur. Though it doesn't really like to, since blurriness isn't the most attractive of features.
text.12: These amphibious birdfish are able to fly and swim at amazing speeds! They can chomp their beaks so hard it creates a sonic shockwave. Despite this, they make terrible dinner guests.
text.17: A fusion of Tundra crystals and dead creature parts, this monster has a mystical aura around it. It seems self-conscious about its ribs.
text.16: It has a resilient shell that can withstand the intense heat and pressure that is constantly building up inside its body. It also enjoys tennis.

text.2: Physical damage with sporadic rapid attacks.
text.3: Physical or fire damage mortar attacks.
text.1: Physical damage with occasional rapid, electric attacks.
text.11: Leap-attack with electric damage. Occasionally teleports to a location and unleashes a volley of ball lightning.
text.9: Fires a physical-damage stomach plug that circles back to itself.
text.15: Fires a random pattern of crystals, dealing ice damage.
text.13: Creates a super-powerful laser beam from between its antlers, dealing electric damage.
text.5: Fires slow-moving electricity balls, with occasional short-range electric discharge.
text.4: Physical attacks with occasional poison cloud eruption.
text.7: Pokes freezing tentacles up from the ground, slowing the target and dealing ice damage.
text.6: Fires a rapid series of exploding tadpoles, dealing physical damage.
text.18: Emits two rotating waves of electrical shocks.
text.0: Physical damage impact with poison cloud explosion. Occasionally fires three projectiles at once.
text.10: Physical damage with lingering poison after-effects.
text.8: Fires physical damage mucus balls either in a cone or in a rapid-fire series.
text.14: Rapid-fire physical damage with lingering poison effects.
text.12: Swooping long-range and explosive short-range physical damage attacks.
text.17: Splits apart and creates a surge of electric damage around its pieces.

text.137: This appears to be poop from a domesticated Wat. It is gross. You are gross.
text.265: This was given to you by a friendly Pikkaye. Yes, that's right. Given.
text.683: When you place your hand on it, you can feel it vibrating and humming slightly.
text.928: This hovering object was identified, and now... IT IS NO MORE!
text.37: If planted in the right type of soil, this will sprout into a lovely Sawgrass plant.
text.135: The fingers of a Wat are renowned for their deliciousness when fried in butter and chocolate. They're also great for flicking things in the eye!
text.277: Tier 4 saw. The moustache of a Bamli is so rugged and manly that you can cut down Bonespurs and Hairbark with it! And lots of other stuff, too!
text.659: This little treat really gets the LEG BLOOD FLOWIN! Boosts your pet's run speed for 3 minutes!
text.920: This would definitely impres your house guests, if anyone would ever come to visit...
text.157: This barrel is JUUUUST big enough to impress a Tartil of any size. Embiggens your Tartil to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.289: A wall from your ship. It has been heavily damaged.
text.763: Although Wompits can't ride this on account of having no arms, one will definitely appreciate the thought. Embiggens your Wompit to EPIC SIZE!
text.32: Level 3 legendary gloves. Don't scratch your nose with these bad boys on.
text.147: Tier 1 fishing pole. Tempt fish into the clutches of your shiny, deadly hook!
text.317: Level 13 Pants. These chaps are exposed in the back, allowing you to enjoy a nice, cool breeze.
text.707: Probably the most hardcore potted hardcore ever potted.
text.968: Standing on this will push you! To the north!
text.169: Level 9 weapon. Its hooked shape is inspired by its origins!
text.329: Level 15 Helm. The insulating nature of Myelar keeps your face toasty warm, like a marshmallow being incinerated over an open flame. It's quite painful.
text.555: It's so hefty, but you already know. Grants your melee attacks a 3% chance to stun enemies.
text.800: Don't get your fingers caught in the Blubes, as they say. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.45: Made of the finest-quality, gold-colored something-or-other. Probably needs a key to open!
text.167: Placing this delicious treat in Savanna water will attract a new school of fish!
text.341: Level 19 Pants. Your legs will thank you after being exposed to the luscious juices of the Ayeayeas... uh... berries?
text.531: Level 35 Glove. The blowhole makes for a great seal, and the hard outer covering makes for a great hard outer covering! All in all, 3/5 stars.
text.792: Perfect for an outing with the rambunctious gents who all live in that one house down the street!
text.2: You notice that if you run with it, you will put your eye out.
text.189: A sign you can write on! With this, you can label areas on your map. IT'S REVOLUTIONARY!
text.353: Level 23 Pants. The power of ancient Bamli horn allows you to leap small things in a single bound or more! HIYOOOO!
text.635: This is going to get moist.
text.880: This'll keep your little toesy woesies nice and comfy womfy!
text.40: Tier 1 pickaxe. This pickaxe will break through even the toughest of Flatstone Boulders! Or at least the weakest ones.
text.179: When Zuglings are approaching maturity, they build their own sparkplugs by hand, and then surgically insert them into their own shells. It's a cultural rite of passage type thing. You wouldn't understand.
text.381: It's full of mites! They build the mound using blood, sweat, tears, and a little bit of elbow grease. The mound is easily popped open with a trowel, though.
text.579: You feel like if you ran at it hard enough, it would give way. Better get started!
text.840: With this knowledge, you can put these papers INTO A FOLDER!
text.201: It's always good to keep a stockpile of Bulbi around. You know... for medicinal purposes.
text.393: You've managed to whack a Bluff hard enough to knock its follicle right out! It doesn't seeem physically possible, but it happened.
text.672: To sustain debates into the depths of the COLD NIGHT, Brubus will keep these lamps lit around their congregation.
text.939: Holding this racket infuses your body with the power of a thousand quadropi. Use it to smash your enemies into wet, fishy dust!
text.53: It's strong and rubbery, like an old garden hose. Or maybe like a new one, if it were a strong and rubbery new one.
text.199: It's always good to maintain a self-replenishing stock of Kibweed to keep your creatures happy.
text.405: A furgrasp must have ripped this tuft off of something... strange...
text.664: Anything from the Tundra should be happy growing in this DELICIOUS FROST!
text.915: It can withstand extreme pressures AND extreme cold! This will attract new schools of fish in the Tundra!
text.221: If you touch both ends of it to your tongue, it shocks you. But it tastes really good, so it's probably worth it.
text.417: This is just a pipe, made out of some type of organic plant matter. It becomes progressively floppier over time.
text.48: Placing this beacon on the ground will allow you to warp to it from your map if you are within range.
text.211: These spurs appear to be quite painful to the Bawg. You'd be doing it a favor by removing them.
text.445: The only organ a Lyff uses to get around. It makes a loud 'BOING' sound when you pull it back and release.
text.712: Somehow, this turns into pipes. Pipedirt. Pipey pipedirty dirt pipes. PIPE.
text.963: It's quite sturdy, despite all the sharp edges that constantly cut into your toes.
text.233: Jollychomps eat these hard stones and use them to grind up whatever they eat. They even use the stones to somehow convert food into other useful materials!
text.457: Whatever you put this next to, it makes that thing seem way more awesome. It's extracted from a domesticated Gulanti!
text.544: Keeping warm is for babies. And you, apparently. Grants 20% resistance to ice damage and freezing effects.
text.811: The horn is from a fallen Polari, and the light comes from that Polari's soul. It's a pretty depressing lamp.
text.61: His majestic moustache is sure to bring good fortune to anyone who strokes it gently.
text.231: This seems to be the baby version of a Throak. It's not very adorable.
text.469: Tier 4 pickaxe. The hair bristles pleasantly against the palm of your hand as you wield it.
text.536: It pulls together all manner of things, strips them into strips, and weaves them together into a weave. BRILLIANT!
text.787: The squishiness of Myelar makes for a terrible writing surface. Good thing you don't have any pencils or paper!
text.3: Tier 1 saw. A saw made of sawgrass. This is the mediumest quality saw you've ever seen, but it should let you chop down logtrees and whistleroots!
text.253: An unexploded Vomma baby. It adorably tries to tear your arm off whenever you pet it. Babies are so cute.
text.481: Juicing up with this bad boy lets you SUCK THE LIFE FROM EVERYONE AROUND YOU! 2% chance to regain health upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.624: This shell looks the same as the exoskeleton of the parents!
text.891: The cutscene showing the BS SS ASSESS traveling through space.
text.56: This toenail is tough and rough. It also tastes pretty bad, but in a good kind of way.
text.243: This enormous tiny sea creature just floats around and gets eaten by things. It has a very stupid life.
text.509: Level 31 Hammer. Although soft and filled with air, flungus pods can do some serious damage in the very, very long term. Years, maybe.
text.584: It's the strongest material in the universe. It makes no sense that you were able to craft it into this shape.
text.835: Slow down time for everything but yourself! And then punch everyone in the neck!
text.73: Why plant seeds in the ground when you can plant them in FACES? Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.258: This tube carries a blue liquid around inside the Bawg. It's really stretchy and rubbery. You could probably whip something really hard with it!
text.701: Now you can chew the eyes off of Pyns any time of the day! But not at night; that'd be weird.
text.950: Look into its eyes. You will see... What you mean to this fish.
text.78: Provide all the creature comforts your creatures deserve. Comes with a name tag!
text.286: This communications console has broken down and is now VERY DANGEROUS!
text.645: You never know when you need a spiked flying snail at your back or front.
text.910: By repeatedly dosing yourself with sunshroom chunks, you become more resistant to LITERALLY EVERY POISON EVER. Reduces poison damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.67: Level 3 chestplate. If you plan to run a marathon, be sure to bring tape.
text.298: Level 17 Axe. You might think something like a floppy tentacle would make for a terrible axe. You might think WRONG.
text.749: Your beak feels beakier just from being near this essence!
text.68: Level 3 boots. These leggings really show off your better features.
text.310: This would be really comfortable to sit in if you had knees.
text.725: Being near this essence makes you feel FLUTTERY AND VIVACIOUS!
text.89: Unfortunately there are no crows on this planet, so this item is probably useless. Still, it looks totally rad.
text.322: The shiny sheen of this floor makes you want to roll around on it, so you might as well.
text.573: It squishes between your toes when you stride across it barefoot, and it sounds a bit like that squealing sound of rubbing a balloon.
text.822: You could probably blow up the whole world with this thing. Breaks apart all Mk4 resources, plus Flunguss, Flailtrees, Pipedirts, and Magmite Mounds!
text.94: This fragrant blossom can be picked from walkerroots. When shoved into your eye, it burns immensely.
text.350: Satgats are self-conscious about their stupid faces, so they love to find new ways to keep themselves covered! Embiggens your Satgat to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.517: It's hard, round, and smooth. Despite its toughness, it has just enough give to make for some pretty good bounces.
text.782: It's like sleeping on a pillow made of gold. You'd think that'd be uncomfortable. WOULDN'T YOU.
text.1: This tiny ship is what you arrived in.
text.83: Wompits love wearing decorative garters on their slender legs. Embiggens your Wompit to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.362: As the saying goes... Sometimes you juice the louse, and sometimes the louse juices you. Restores 9,670 HP.
text.621: Something adorable is probably going to come out of this. That, or a hideous flying insect.
text.870: You gotta rub it the right way, and then nothing happens. Genies aren't real, you weirdo.
text.84: Temporarily stun your opponents for 2 seconds by hitting them directly in the face with this fashionable mirror!
text.374: These plants grow in pairs, and they have a shifty attitude. It would be wise not to trust them. Restores 7,103 HP.
text.597: This makes you momentarily forget how unimportant you are!
text.862: WHO STOLE THE COOKIES FROM WITHIN THIS MAGNIFICENT JAR!?
text.105: Slapping it creates a hollow drum sound. With enough of these, you could form a genuine hippie commune.
text.386: A cluster of bioluminescent algae that has adapted to only grow on ice. Your tongue sticks to it if you lick it. Restores 16,906 HP.
text.694: Its long, slender fingers are still gross to look at.
text.957: Yeah, you got murdered a lot, but now you have this cool statue! So... that's good.
text.110: You wonder what this leg bone would have been connected to. Probably something giant.
text.414: This little bugger will chop the back of your face off if you take your eyes off it for a second. Just to be safe, you should try it.
text.654: It uses extremely soft and well-insulated wood to keep creatures and their eggs warm!
text.901: This key probably opens up a chest or something... something like that. WHO KNOWS?
text.99: This initially soft substance becomes extremely hard over time.
text.426: A lamp from Hewgodooko's base that goes on the floor. It glows a beautiful teal. The color reminds you of toothpaste, or the ocean, or stuff like that.
text.100: Glidopi hide their beaks deep within their stomachs, or something. Honestly, the purpose of this thing is a mystery.
text.438: The heart of a Glaser's extreme energy powers, this charge hub would be able to power a small cell phone.
text.734: This Zug energy ball makes grating shrieking noises. It's oddly calming!
text.981: It's so cold that you can't feel it when it pokes you! CONVENIENT! Boosts your ice damage by 20%.
text.121: It's a bit firm to sit on, but oddly comfortable for very short periods of time.
text.450: These ribs provide protection for the warp core of a Gallum. Not enough protection, apparently, because you easily pried it out with your bare hands.
text.566: By focusing light into a tiny point onto your retina, you're able to instantly trade places with your pet somehow. There's a lot of science packed into this thing.
text.829: By fusing together three powerful Gongs, you may just be able to fish up the legendary Megagong with this equipped!
text.126: Every day it grows a new batch of glowing berries, and it opens up at night. The berries are so glowy that they're visible from space!
text.478: Like the chemistry set you had as a kid, but morbid.
text.526: Blastcrabs care about one thing only, and that's burning everything. Embiggens your Blastcrab to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.773: Giving this to a Satgat lets it see its house from here. Embiggens your Satgat to EPIC SIZE!
text.115: Carefully harvested from the furiously flapping wings of a domesticated Glutterfly. The dust gets all over everything and is very hard to get out.
text.490: Level 27 Chest. It protect, lifts, and supports! Your dignity, that is.
text.614: The glowing orbs are hypnotic. You can feel yourself drooling as you watch it.
text.877: This INCREDIBLE INVENTION summons 3 lightning balls that will shock your enemies when you strike them for 70% of your dps!
text.116: Give this to a creature to teach him basic banking skills! A banker creature will sometimes produce useful things for you.
text.502: Level 29 Helm. You could put a lot of eyes out with these things.
text.606: Walking on it gives your toes immense pleasure. YEAH, TOES!
text.853: Once majestically soaring through space, now majestically not soaring anywhere ever again.
text.138: This workstation can handle all kinds of abuse! And it spins!
text.271: Although Wojacks spend a lot of time undergound, they appear to have very sophisticated eyeballs.
text.679: This would go well with your new drapes, or some kinda fashionable stuff like that.
text.940: This orb has seen a lot of use. Veeru technology lasts forever, though. So... NO PROBLEM!
text.132: This extremely volatile compound is produced in the belly of a domesticated Tartil. It must be extracted very carefully.
text.275: Tier 1 trowel. This trowel should come in handy for POPPING plants and stubborn organisms out of the ground! And that's about it. It's a trowel, what do you want?
text.671: Brubus congregants will often write their meeting minutes on golden tablets. You know, for posterity.
text.916: It wriggles and tries to grab onto stuff with tiny tendrils.
text.11: This berry is purple, which definitely means it's poisonous. Or maybe that was red. In any case, some color means poisonous.
text.158: With the power of weeds, you can tether anything to anything!
text.295: This beacon allows you to come back to life on the B.S. S.S. Assess.
text.759: You can feel the power coursing through it! OH GOOD LORDY! OH MY! OH MY STARS!
text.144: Level 7 weapon. Filling Squee barrels with Blastique makes for an incredibly unwieldy hammer. Fortunately, that's just your style.
text.315: Level 13 Glove. Wrapping your hands in the loving Vlaps of a Vomma makes you feel warm, safe, and secure.
text.719: Vigorously poke everything TO DEATH! Deals 200% of your DPS as physical damage!
text.964: It's not clear where this fur came from, but it makes for a great carpet!
text.170: Level 9 helm. Pointy, tough, and royal as F... fish.
text.335: Tier 2 trowel. A much more rugged trowel than its predecessor, the Splintrowel can pry just about anything out of the ground!
text.551: Rubbing this sack all over your face should cure what ails ya! Grants 20% poison damage resistance.
text.812: The beats that emerge from this drum are so fat, they could definitely stand to spend some time in the gym.
text.164: It tastes of cashews. Also cleanses 1,378 poison from your body.
text.339: Level 19 Chest. The airsaks protect your amazing chest skin from imminent harm, and the Wojack spice exfoliates your pores. High-tech!
text.543: This is how you know you've made it. Grants a 10% chance when breaking resources to find double the normal amount of components!
text.788: It's like putting your butt on a cloud. A cloud made of air.
text.9: It has a nicely polished sheen, and you get splinters when you slide your bare feet along it. So don't do that.
text.190: Everybody knows that the bigger your biceps, the harder you hit stuff. Improves damage dealt by 5%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.359: Drinking this brew makes you want to punch stuff! 2% chance to stun enemies upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.631: The egg seems ready to zoom off into the sunset.
text.892: Shows the cutscene of Hewgodooko destroying the BS SS Assess
text.176: It's way too perfectly spherical to possibly fit a hat on. Still, it looks GREAT!
text.379: It's unclear whether this is a type of coral, a plant, an animal, or something in between. The sounds it makes as the wind blows through the pipes remind you of an old timey church organ!
text.591: Nobody can get through this door! Unless they open it.
text.836: This Snorble sack is unusually durable and floaty. If only there were a use for something like that...
text.202: You can take it as well as you can dish it out! Provides 5% chance to poison enemies and 5% poison resistance.
text.399: It has a convenient grip, almost as it if was made to be thrown by you and you alone. As you gaze upon the flailpod, you feel butterflies in your stomach. It was meant to be.
text.684: If you look closely, you can see old burn marks on the antlers from the heat of its laser!
text.935: The top portion of the legendary Lens. Just being near it fills you with a sense of heroism and wonder.
text.196: Level 11 gloves. The extra layer of Wat fur really helps keep your sensitive elbows warm!
text.403: These leaves are fibrous, almost as if they were woven together by a tiny person with tiny, tiny fingers. Like a baby, or perhaps a very small monkey.
text.660: This remarkable contraption allows you to instantly warp to the Bawg!
text.927: In honor of you whooping some serious rockbutt.
text.15: A soft, tender leaf from the Sawgrass plant. It feels good to rub your face on it, though it causes rashes.
text.222: Harvested from the silkparts of a domesticated Satgat. It's so ridiculously soft, you could probably make a very expensive pair of underpants from it!
text.423: This chair was found in one of Hewgodooko's bases. The craftsmanship is exquisite. Looking at this chair, you wonder whether Hewgodooko was once a skilled carpenter, and if so, why he would know how to build chairs if he can levitate.
text.764: Despite conventional wisdom, Glutterflies have terrible eyesight at night. BUT NOT WITH THIS! Embiggens your Glutterfly to EPIC SIZE!
text.208: This large blister is JAM-PACKED full of a succulent fluid! It'll take a lot of vigorous pumping to get it all out.
text.443: Shirks like an extra pinch of salt on their meals, so this salt gland really comes in handy for such occasions.
text.708: Potted Parapods present prolific parapod production possibilities!
text.234: Jollies are capable of spitting these balls of sticky, disgusting goo at predators to keep them away. It rarely works.
text.463: Much like a grill lighter, this gland sends sparks into the Blastcrab's body and lights... whatever is in there.
text.556: With a bit of extra thought, you can always do things better. Grants a 5% chance on swing to break resources apart completely.
text.807: It's squishy, wet, and moderately lumpy. PERFECT FOR A PET TO LIVE IN!
text.228: This sticky substance is extremely smelly, and it would probably kill you if you covered yourself with it and set yourself on fire.
text.467: You've packed about as much glow juice into one place as you possibly can. This thing should stay lit for... FRICKIN' EONS.
text.532: Level 35 Pants. Having a blowhole wrapped around your thigh reminds you of your college days.
text.799: This seedbomb really gets on people's... nurva. HEEEEEEH. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.13: Glutterflies go crazy for this kind of crap. Embiggens your Glutterfly to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.254: Vomma are covered with these fleshy flaps. Their primary purpose seems to be for decoration. Lady Vommas love a man with big flaps.
text.487: If there's one thing a Glaser can't resist, it's a space traveler in tight spandex flinging a ball of awkwardly-assembled objects at it. Embiggens your Glaser to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.636: As the saying goes, if you want to hatch a Glutterfly, you gotta build one of these.
text.887: It's not a party until you ride in on one of these.
text.240: Tiny creatures are living inside these tubes. They don't like being out of the Bawg's acid, but you don't really care.
text.507: Tier 5 saw. The jagged spines of Slurbs make for an amazing saw. They are also great conversation starters and enders!
text.580: It squishes when you press your face all up on it. Probably not the soundest of construction materials, but what are you gonna do?
text.847: Whatever is inside this, it had better be important.
text.260: Plucked from the branches of an Artree, this potato-shaped saggy sack seems to be full of fat.
text.689: Its horribleness haunts your dreams. AND EVEN YOUR NIGHTMARES.
text.954: If this is present on-screen, there will be cheering sounds.
text.280: By jamming a reed into a water balloon, you're now able to fling it with TREMENDOUS FORCE onto your seeds! Seeds love that kinda stuff, right?
text.649: Flying barrel bugs with tiny heads make great pets. You read that on the internet once.
text.898: The Tendraam use these circular roots as a symbol of eternal bonding. Also can be used as garnish.
text.23: Legends say that the Stone Wall was first invented by a one-gloved man with sweet dance moves.
text.300: Level 21 Sword. This intuitively effective weapon can slice through even the mightiest of... Well, all kinds of stuff, really.
text.737: Being near this essence makes you REALLY want to barf. But in a REALLY GOOD way.
text.304: Not only does it look super comfortable, it also emits an eerie glow that makes you feel queasy!
text.729: Holding this object in your hand makes you wish your hand was a tentacle.
text.978: Turns out if you mix a bunch of poisonous stuff together, the result is still poisonous! Boosts your poison damage by 20%.
text.324: This amazing-looking chest will hold whatever you put in it! Except love. Nothing can contain love.
text.561: Harness the power of Throaks to blast a hostile enemy with THE COLDITUDE OF ICE! Deals 100% of your DPS as ice damage.
text.344: Level 21 Glove. By covering your arms with Satgat exoskeletons, you've managed to look... not leaf-like whatsoever.
text.521: Level 33 Pants. These boots will grant you the style of one eagle and the finesse of another eagle, high-fiving as they soar through space.
text.770: It's good to protect the Noggin when TUNNELING CRAZILY UNDERGROUND LIKE AN ULTRABEAST! Embiggens your Wojack to EPIC SIZE!
text.19: These shrooms love to grow in mud, and they taste salty. Restores 149 HP.
text.364: Its long, claw-like branches often snag the fur of animals that pass by. It probably uses the fur for knitting hats.
text.609: If this hit you in the face at a high speed in the dark, it would be hilarious.
text.368: Something is stirring under the cold, icy waters.
text.601: A root of the plant known as Maarla. It hums with the energy of life!
text.850: Want to go to SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE? Now you can.
text.388: This larva looks like it has suffered from decompression sickness. It probably came from somewhere incredibly deep under the ground...
text.698: Drinking this cocktail heightens your senses! ALL OF THEM. Puts you in bullet-time for 3 seconds.
text.945: The final cutscene of the game!
text.408: Flungi home in on these bees to deposit their spores, or something. Planting one of these in Furdle Frost should generate a Flungus, at any rate!
text.642: How hot does a Blastcrab egg need to be? Probably... probably hot.
text.905: It sticks everything... TO DEATH! Deals 75% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.31: Level undefined gloves. These gloves are hard as rocks. Well, bones, actually. But it's close.
text.428: This lantern is yella. Yella, like the colah of the skah on a nahce summa dah.
text.746: Just being near this makes you sprout a RAGING MOUSTACHE.
text.432: Dis lamp has uh bluh gluh.
text.722: Disgustingly keep track of all the cool stuff you find!
text.985: Being near it fills your heart with ice. It's probably fatal. Boosts your ice damage by 30%.
text.452: This would be one of the toughest substances known to mankind, if it were substantially tougher... and known to mankind.
text.570: Change the climate by creating a MICROSTORM right over your own head! The storm will strike enemies with lightning every second while the storm persists, each strike damaging for 75% of your DPS.
text.817: This contraption is packed full of lightning! Summons a lightning storm at the target location for 100% of your DPS for 7 seconds.
text.472: Level 25 Helm. The last thing your enemies will remember is the shining glimmer of your beautiful shirkbeak smile.
text.514: Level 31 Pants. The fluff feels good in between your toes. Or it would, if you had some.
text.777: Give that Slurb a trampoline. Slurbs love trampolines. Embiggens your Slurb to EPIC SIZE!
text.27: Level 3 helm. This will protect your scalp from almost the mightiest of touches.
text.492: Level 27 Glove. The high levels of acid on the inside will definitely render your hands soft and tender. Everyone loves soft hands!
text.618: The egg is made of crystal chunks, just like its parents. It seems shy. You know, for an egg.
text.865: In the event of a water landing, please follow the illuminated BLUBELIGHTS to your imminent doom.
text.496: It's hard and scratch-proof, and polished to a perfect sheen. Nothing you do seems to dent it, and it hums gently when you come near it.
text.857: Although mostly inedible, if you mix a spaceduck up with actual food, it makes for a FANTASTIC pie! Restores 162 HP.
text.39: This will be incredibly useful for whatever you might use an ordinary pile of small rocks for.
text.143: Super absorbant and pleasing to the touch, Squee flooring can make a house out of even the dankest of dungeons!
text.261: By plunging this into the Bawg's flesh, you can foster the growth of new Artrees. Which you can then stab repeatedly with sharp tools.
text.691: The tar never seems to dry, no matter how long it sits. Fortunately, it smells terrible.
text.952: It marks where you died, and sucks up all your loot!
text.129: These bioluminescent berries are warm to the touch and emit a deep humming sound.
text.281: It's a door from your ship!
text.651: How do you hatch a Throak egg? No, seriously... is this right?
text.896: Waves of stuff bounce off the bowl shaped part and shoot out in directions toward things!
text.34: Level 1 helm. I'M THE KING OF THE WOOD!
text.155: This compound burns your hand when you touch it. It also explodes when you touch it. Basically, don't touch it.
text.301: Level 23 Axe. By harnessing the power of the Bamli, you've managed to assemble an axe that can strike down ALL WHO STAND BEFORE YOU! Almost.
text.739: Holding this makes you feel like you could just FLOAT AWAY!
text.149: Its head is jiggly and full of some kind of squishy substance. It looks concerned about this. Restores 436 HP.
text.305: Something about the color of this pillow makes you feel insightful and creative.
text.731: This sticks to everything IN THE WHOLE UNIVERSE. Except for love, which is an intangible idea that things can't stick to.
text.976: Some of the juice inside Woanope has crystallized and burst through the planet's crust. HEY, FREE JUICE!
text.47: Chugging one of these will make you feel as calm as a summer breeze. Restores 453 HP.
text.325: Level 17 Helm. Looking at this helm makes you wonder if you'll ever be able to get it off. Good thing it's stylish, or you'd be concerned.
text.563: Using ethically questionable stem cell research, you're able to restore 50% of your missing HP. Now that's progress!
text.824: This bobber will bob into Bawg or Savanna water and EXPLODE FISH RIGHT OUT OF THEIR SCHOOLS! Bobbly!
text.161: Nothing like the smell of putrid, deadly gases to get you under your desk in the morning. Deals 250% of your DPS as a mixture of poison and physical damage.
text.345: Level 21 Pants. Although pointy on the outside, the inside is soft and warm. It will protect your most important parts.
text.523: It makes horrible squealing noises as it extracts oil from the waters of the Tundra. It makes you feel like dancing.
text.768: Nothing charges up a Zug's chargey parts like a thing that violates the laws of physics! Embiggens your Zug to EPIC SIZE!
text.42: Level 5 weapon. You once read about this in a National Geographic. It seems effective.
text.187: Wats are renowned for their love of sports! Embiggens your Wat to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.365: It's unclear what laid this egg. But it is clear that it's packed with nutrients and goodies, like some kind of natural pinata.
text.611: Standing near it makes you want to throw your hands in the air, almost as if you simply don't care.
text.872: With its ability to burn for up to eight moments, shirk blubber makes for a very versatile lamp!
text.181: When a domesticated Zug is overfed, it has to shed its skin. It shocks you every time you touch it!
text.369: This flat, fish-like creature clings to ice chunks and blends in with them. It also speaks several languages, none of which you understand.
text.603: A fully blossomed flower of Maarla. Its purple glow fills you with warmth and craving for burritos.
text.848: It's a floor! From your ship.
text.207: Some kind of hybrid between a living claw and an Agave-like plant, this taco-meat-flavored organism may very well restore 1,560 HP.
text.389: This tiny critter uses advanced elegtromagnetic-detecting neurons to find the nearest neck and strangle it. It would make a great gift for children you hate.
text.696: When you gaze upon its face, you are reminded of how stupid it was in life.
text.947: It's space debris from a space explosion!
text.193: Level 11 helm. The sparkplugs energize your brain and help you to think more clearly!
text.409: This pod has avoided being exploded by your violent attacks. You sense that it is terrifed of you, and probably delicious.
text.640: Be sure not to stick your tongue on this while it's hatching. That'd be gross.
text.907: Drinking this pungent mixture innervates you with WILD ENERGY! Improves critical strike chance by 3%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.50: This plant makes hilarious squealing noises as the wind blows through it. Each plant makes a unique pitch!
text.219: These smiley little guys like to hang out in groups, and they're always hungry. If you feed them, they give you something in return!
text.429: This lantern glows a deep, reddish-orange. It reminds you of the fiery eyes of a demon you once loved.
text.744: This little ball of Wojack energy makes you want to DIG! DIG INTO THE GERND!
text.213: Just a regular, ordinary, person-sized strand of hair.
text.433: This hologram stores a memory print of whatever the user exposes it to. Unfortunately, it's too sophisticated for your feeble mind to understand how to update the display. Still, it looks nice!
text.720: What, this? IT'S NOT PINK. IT'S FUCHSIA.
text.63: It takes a lot of chemicals to work with all these crazy materials. This should do the trick!
text.239: This plant-like organism somehow thrives in the acidic pools of the Bawg. It turns the acid into a bioluminescent glow, which it uses to lure in unsuspecting Plonktans to eat.
text.453: You ripped that Gulanti a new, slightly bigger blowhole in exactly the same place as its old one.
text.568: At the press of a button, DBot will come to your rescue, making you invincible! But he gets tired easily, so don't wear him out.
text.819: A more powerful harvestbomb, for breaking apart all kinds of stuff! Breaks apart all Mk1 resources, plus Flatboulders, Squees, and Dusk Crystals!
text.225: Snorbles use these as a form of currency. If you treat a domesticated Snorble well, it might give you one!
text.473: Level 25 Chest. Smashblossom parts can really take a pounding, and now, so can you!
text.512: Level 31 Chest. It's tight, which is what makes it so nice.
text.779: Play it cool, crabby. CRABBY COOL! COOL CRAB COOL CAKES! Embiggens your Blastcrab to EPIC SIZE!
text.58: You've managed to kill a wompit and steal its skin. Hopefully you have a good reason for this kind of rude behavior.
text.251: To aid in flight, the Bamli inflates its Flightbladder with absolutely nothing. Once the bladder is inflated, the Bamli becomes buoyant in the air and soars like a majestic eagle.
text.493: By dumping slurry into the Slurrifier, you'll be able to clean it up and extract something useful from it.
text.616: Even before it is fully hatched, the Bamli sports a proud moustache.
text.867: IT'S AN ARRANGEMENT OF FLOWERS. THAT'S ALL IT IS. GET OVER IT.
text.245: This projection of a Nurva is used to poke the eyes of things that wander nearby. As you look closer at it, it pokes you in the eye. You're not sure what you expected.
text.497: This toxic goo is a primary component of slurry. It sticks to everything it touches, including your nostrils.
text.592: You are using the trusty Bureau of Shipping Self-Sustaining Survival Station Series S-5! It'll get you started on this hostile alien planet.
text.859: Because blowing bubbles yourself is far too time-consuming.
text.74: It's warm and delightful. If only you had some hot cocoa to dip your toes into.
text.270: This must be how the Wojacks get around underground. It won't stop wiggling around.
text.677: IT'S BLUE AND IT GLOWS. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT FROM IT.
text.942: Although it looks like a regular tennis ball, it is extremely dense.
text.77: Floors prevent wild creatures from randomly popping up in your house, and can also be used as bridges!
text.274: The severed arm of a Wojack. It wasn't really using it, anyway.
text.669: This makes a giant hair emerge from the ground. Why? HAIRCONE!
text.918: It shimmers and glursts with GLORIOUS YNNIX ENERGY!
text.64: It's extremely tough and hard to pronounce. But it catches the light in a really awesome way!
text.294: This is how you keep track of your science!
text.757: Touching this essence gives you the vague sense that you are severely burning off your fingers.
text.5: This stone is so unbelievably flat you could probably barely squeeze a sheet of paper between it and something else.
text.71: This bomb packs quite a punch. A PUNCH IN THE NECK! Deals 200% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.314: With the power of WRITING ON WOOD PULP, you are now able to convey your love toward the Bureau of Shipping. Great job!
text.717: The salt gland causes a chemical reaction, and then CHEMISTRY HAPPENS! Deals 250% of your DPS as physical damage!
text.90: Level 5 helm. Like a helmet, but with a little more pizazz.
text.334: Stretched and slapped Bleghpods make for an excellent container!
text.549: With the right amount of poison, you can overcome just about anything! Grants a 10% chance to poison enemies on melee attacks.
text.814: Dunking will be difficult in the gravity of this planet, and also without knees or a hoop.
text.93: Level 5 gloves. Solid as the carapace of a dead bug and with extra gripping strength to match.
text.338: Level 19 Helm. This will either convince your enemies that you're a snorble, or convince your enemies that you're a crazy person wearing snorble parts on your face.
text.541: You can see clearly now; the pain is gone. Reduces cooldowns of all items by 15%.
text.790: It's so dang smooth you can see your butt's reflection in it!
text.80: It squeaks annoyingly when you rub your hands all over it.
text.358: It goes down smooth, like a smoooooth smoothie. Restores 125,060 HP.
text.629: It wobbles like jelly when you slap it. You should probably not slap it.
text.894: Legends say this power crystal was once wielded by a powerful elderly Indian man.
text.4: Level 2 weapon. This bad boy is 100% certified organic. ORGANICALLY DEADLY.
text.87: Supreme suction elongates the optical nerve, allowing you to crit like a champ! Increases critical strike chance by 10%!
text.378: This tree twitches when hostile creatures come near it, but it never swings. You surmise that it might be a pacifist.
text.589: The tough knobs make it hard to close and open, but they also make it easier, you know, in some respects.
text.838: This spur pulp throbs with the ENERGIES OF LIFE!
text.106: The beautiful, yet oddly rigid, husk of a Squee plant. Rubbing your fingers over it produces a pleasing sensation. Maybe a little too pleasing...
text.398: It's pretty jittery. It can only be calmed down by the rhythmic, explosive pounding of a Smashblossom.
text.686: It's so realistic, you can almost feel it licking you. ALMOST.
text.933: It crackles with energy, though it seems somehow subdued.
text.109: The tusks on this skull indicate that the beast it once belonged to had tusks.
text.402: The Furgrasp uses these long, pointy appendages to rip tufts of fur from... something.
text.662: It's pretty frosty, and moderately perma, too.
text.925: This Krakalaka is waiting to devour every package.
text.96: Slap one of these in a patch of rare vegetation to remember where it is!
text.422: This table was built by Hewgodooko's bare hands. Or whatever he uses for this kind of thing. Lasers, probably. Bare lasers.
text.766: Once this bomb is absorbed into the squishy body of a Tartil, ALL BETS ARE OFF! Embiggens your Tartil to EPIC SIZE!
text.7: This tree appears to be made of logs. You wonder what the people back home would make of this.
text.103: A perfect shard of a dusk crystal. It has the majestic aura of a skateboarding dog.
text.442: These feathers give Shirks their beautiful, glorious majesty. They truly are nature's most beautiful carnivorous flying bird shark monsters.
text.710: Her voluptuous insectoid curves attract all the magmite mans!
text.973: Standing on this will push you SUPER FAST! To the east!
text.122: With enough love and care, you can cultivate your very own Squee garden!
text.462: It's not very firm under normal conditions, but it hardens instantly when exposed to explosions.
text.558: Sometimes it just takes a little fire under the tush. Increases move speed by 15% when health is low!
text.805: It's about to get piping hot in here. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.125: This pungent-smelling plant grows in patches. It produces bags of a strange gas.
text.466: This high-energy goo binds the cosmic energy of the Gallum's crystals together. If you treat a domesticated Gallum well, it might give you some!
text.534: Take your Gallum to the next level OF PUZZLING ACTION! Embiggens your Gallum to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.797: You could easily impale almost any body part on almost any part of this amazing chair!
text.112: In the darkest of times, this ornate device will keep your surroundings illuminated. In the brightest of times, it's completely useless.
text.486: Stabbing a Squeti with a spine makes for a great kebab! Oh, but remind your pet to remove the skewer before eating it. Restores 66,240 HP.
text.638: You figure it's about time you raised your own pointy-fingered bat creature.
text.885: When you need to know how hot it is, the only way to tell is with a person-sized thermometer.
text.6: Level 3 weapon. A high-tech hammer crafted from the finest of flatstones. Used for pounding things. WITH STYLE!
text.119: These ancient amber chunks are found in the bodies of Tartils. You can see tiny bugs trapped inside.
text.506: Slurbs rely on magnetism to powercharge their leaps. Embiggens your Slurb to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.582: It's more dense than the densest of black holes. Fortunately it isn't one, or you would have fallen in by now.
text.845: Level 27 Legendary Pants. These will keep your toes so hot, you can't help but RUN LIKE THE WINGS OF THE WIND!
text.140: Level 7 gloves. The palms are covered with a super sticky gripping surface.
text.259: This little guy latches onto Blubes and drinks the blood of the Bawg. It's pretty gross, but he doesn't seem too concerned.
text.703: These adorable Bunnions scream endlessly until eaten. They're SO CUUUUTE!
text.948: It's about to blow! Or... suck? Whatever, it's going to throw some packages through a wormhole.
text.130: Two gassak sacks fused together, presumably at the hip. They're inseparable.
text.287: This is great for clearing broken ship parts, and for stunning creatures at a distance!
text.647: There's no way this will keep a Lyff egg intact. But you're going to try it anyway.
text.908: Wompits are known to live up to 700 years. And now, SO CAN YOU! Regenerate 0.50% of max HP every 2 seconds. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.152: Perfect for keeping the baddies away!
text.299: Level 19 Hammer. It's about time you gave those Snorbles a taste of their own saks.
text.751: This essence causes you to crave grass. MMMMMM GRASS HOLY CRAP YEAH!
text.150: Just a regular old piece of alien seaweed. It's extremely fibrous and tough.
text.311: This darkened bagchair is sure to attract... nothing, actually. You're the only person on this planet. But dang, does this bagchair look good.
text.727: It vibrates and chirps with the POWER OF GLUTTERFLIES! You get the sense that licking it would kill you.
text.172: Level 9 gloves. Your hands have never been so scaly.
text.323: There's nothing quite like the bones of a thousand alien cow hippos to really add spice to a room.
text.820: More powerful than its weaker cousin, this bomb is powerful, and not weak. Breaks apart all Mk2 resources, plus Nurvas!
text.162: With this beautiful, ornate lamp at your side, you suddenly feel less afraid of fire. Grants +20% fire resistance.
text.351: The moustache of a Bamli is so powerful, you can use it to BEND ANYTHING TO YOUR WILL! It's also super attractive.
text.519: Level 33 Chest. It's strong enough for a man, and also strong enough for a woman. Because women and men are equal.
text.780: This will protect the electroneck of your glorious GULANTI! Embiggens your Gulanti to EPIC SIZE!
text.184: When hammered into a triangular shape and infused with the souls of Glidopus babies, Dusk Crystals sure make one heck of a prism!
text.363: It's a sagtatoe in a tube! But this isn't fit for human consumption, so... PET FOOD IT IS! Restores 13,407 HP to your pet.
text.623: When threatened, the egg makes a high-pitched ululating sound. Like father, like son.
text.868: Probably one of the more flungus-like shrubberies you've seen, but it'll get the job done.
text.182: Tier 2 pickaxe. Jamming a Wat finger into a Zug shell seemed like a good idea at the time. AND IT STILL DOES! This thing can break through Dusk crystals!
text.375: This thing is sharp and pointy. It seems pretty hardcore.
text.599: Fondling this shrine makes everything seem REALLY BORING.
text.860: Using gravity quantum particulate energy matrix multiplication, this little tool will cause you to not consume a bomb and incur no bomb cooldown 25% of the time when you throw it!
text.204: Bumpberries are pretty rare. It'd be a good idea to keep a few pots of them around!
text.387: This plant grows perfect sponges made of copper. This will be super helpful when you have to do the dishes.
text.692: The tentacles get stuck on you as you walk past. It's delightful!
text.959: Because individually slapping pot slappers is for chumps. Now you can laser them all at once!
text.194: Level 11 chestplate. The crystal creates a nice, reflective surface that really accentuates your curves.
text.415: This substance is harder than anything you've ever seen. The Magmites build their nests around this stuff, apparently hoping to mine it. So far they have never succeeded.
text.652: There's no way to know whether this will work. Actually, there is. LET'S DO THIS!
text.216: Level 12 Helm. After painstakingly finding the sturdiest giant skull around, you've assembled what many would consider to be... a fantastic hat.
text.427: This lantern is so green, you wonder if it could possibly get any greener. The answer is yes... OR IS IT? No, it's not.
text.740: This essence gives you the feeling of HURGH BLAGH!
text.214: These plants grow deep within the tissue of the Bawg. In many ways, they're a lot like potatoes. In many other ways, they're absolutely nothing like potatoes.
text.439: It bounces and makes wet slapping noises when you throw it against things.
text.732: This ball of Wat energy rapidly flits around as you approach it! OR DOES IT? Yes, it does.
text.983: If your knuckles aren't hairy enough to generate static, sometimes you gotta find a workaround. Boosts your electric damage by 30%.
text.236: This tasty treat is belched out of the mouth of a Jollychomp under the right conditions. It smells and tastes fruity-licious!
text.451: This meat holds the ribs of a Gallum together. Throw that in a pot with some salt and pepper, and baby, you've got a stew going.
text.564: The moustache of a Bamli builds up static charges so fast, you'd be crazy NOT to weaponize it! Deals 100% of your DPS as lightning damage to your target and all nearby targets as well.
text.831: You have heard legends of three Sawgrass blades stuck together... but you never imagined it could be so beautiful.
text.226: It's really rough on one side, but on the other side it's gross and wet. This is bit of a no-win situation, really.
text.479: Tier 3 trowel. Antlers and hooves are terrible at prying things off the ground, until you combine them. In a sense, they're like the mustard and mayonnaise of a deviled egg.
text.524: Priming your Bagpump with an Icequill lets you extract this from the water. It's oily on the outside, and oilier on the inside!
text.775: THIS PIERCES THE EARS. NOT THE LOBES, BUT... YOU KNOW... THE DRUMS. Embiggens your Shirk to EPIC SIZE!
text.248: Level 21 Axe. You aren't sure which end to hold this thing by. It's pretty pointy no matter how you approach it.
text.491: Level 27 Helm. It'll protect your face so hard, you won't even know what hit you. Seriously, you'll have no idea.
text.612: Putting your eye up to it leaves a gross ring of goo around your eye socket.
text.879: It's so exciting to keep count of your steps, that every 50 steps you'll burst into a joyful sprint!
text.246: This styrofoam-like tissue can be ripped from Nurvas, and it makes for great electrical insulation!
text.503: Level 29 Chest. Nothing insulates your saucy torso like a Squeti.
text.604: The Tendraam use these small buds of Maarla as light sources at night.
text.855: This is where the space sits.
text.264: The Bawg has apparently never heard of conditioner.
text.681: When you've bested this many bamlis, you'd best put it on display.
text.930: When it comes to poteting, this poteti just couldn't potet.
text.276: Tier 3 pickaxe. This pickaxe is insanely sturdy, for being made out of tentacles and plants!
text.657: THE FLAVOR MAKES YOUR MOUTH EXPLODE WITH HAPPINESS! For a couple seconds. Restores 6,521 HP.
text.922: Much like the original, it is hard as a rock and ruthless.
text.288: This door has broken down, and it's now shooting electricity everywhere!
text.761: Your neck feels stretchy when you hold this. Almost TOO stretchy.
text.22: Sawcles have been used in construction for generations!
text.316: Level 13 Chest. You feel warm and cuddly when you wrap yourself in a majestic suit of Vlaps.
text.705: Potted Icequills don't have the same vibrant glow as wild ones. Still, WHATEVER!
text.970: Standing on this will push you! To the west!
text.328: Level 17 Pants. By attaching cilia to the bottom of your feet, you feel like you're gliding along the ground. You're not, but... it definitely feels like it.
text.553: Keeping these around reminds you of your days as an Olympic sprinter. Ah, simpler times. Increases run speed by 5%!
text.802: Why grow spurs when you can EXPLODE THEM AT THINGS? Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.340: Level 19 Glove. Snorble Airsaks are velvety soft on the inside. It's like having your hand in a real glove!
text.529: Level 35 Helm. It fits so snugly over your skull, you can barely hear, think, see, or breathe. So protective!
text.794: The fuzz keeps your rear-end nice and toasty!
text.352: You've treated this wood such that you can write and erase stuff on it! Now you can label parts of the map.
text.633: You'd think Wompits wouldn't lay eggs, on account of them being mammals. You'd be wrong.
text.882: Let your neighbors know they're welcome to take your mat with this mat that tells your neighbors they're welcome to take it!
text.18: A byproduct from cutting wood. If you stick your hands in the pile, it feels awesome. And it smells great!
text.380: A chunk of pristine, green crystal protruding up from the shattered crystalline area of the Tundra. It sings and vibrates when it senses you are near it.
text.577: It's so hard that if you fell face-first on it, it would break. Your face, not the floor.
text.842: It's full of wonderful fish goodies!
text.392: Although it looks like an adorable rabbit, it's just a camouflaged root vegetable. Ignore the fact that it screams when you eat it. That's part of the camouflage. Restores 40,293 HP.
text.674: The Brubus have tremendous regard for greasing the wheels of democracy.
text.404: After murdering its father, the least you can do is plant this seed. Don't be a barbarian.
text.666: Your pole is totally gonna be so awesome for the fishings after you touch this.
text.913: Drinking this makes your skin feel rubbery and wubbery! Reduces electric damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.416: You can't imagine what this might be useful for.
text.30: Level 1 gloves. Protect your fat, sausagey fingers WITH THE POWER OF WOOD!
text.444: Legends say that Lyffs will give shards of their crystals to those they consider friends. What legends? You know... the legends.
text.714: Deals 100% of your DPS as frost damage and makes your enemies crave hot cocoa!
text.961: It's so dense it probably won't even soak up all the juice that's going to get spilled on it!
text.456: You know that feeling when you rub your socks on the carpet, then touch something, and it zaps you? Touching this thing feels nothing like that.
text.546: Just having this beautiful thing around makes you want to rub all up on your enemies and steal their lives away! Grants a 5% chance to steal health from enemies on melee attack.
text.809: This half-shell comes from deep in the frigid waters of the Tundra. At least... at least 10 or 12 feet deep.
text.468: Now you're crafting with Wompit parts!
text.538: Spinning. It makes the world go round.
text.480: The sagtatoe container really brings out the flavonoids. Restores 6,521 HP.
text.626: You have to be careful while handling it, so as to not impale your entire everything.
text.889: Create the effect of warping through space!
text.508: Good thing it runs on its own, or you'd end up with a lot of disfiguring scars!
text.586: When it retracts, red goo squirts out. It smells like candy!
text.833: This crystal shard is shaped kinda like... an insect of some sort...
text.141: Level 7 boots. They're so tight you can see your rippling calves through the material.
text.257: Something is moving around under all that acid...
text.699: It's so firm and glowy! Standing near it makes you feel queasy and nauseous, for some reason.
text.36: Under the right conditions, this will grow into a majestic Logtree over time.
text.131: This little bug seems to feed on the gas produced inside Gassak Gas Sacks. It looks sad that you have destroyed its home and family.
text.643: This might be tricky, on account of the egg attempting to teleport away all the time.
text.904: Tendraam carry roots of Maarla as their most sentimental personal possession. It seems PRETTY USELESS!
text.153: Level 11 weapon. It's not happy about being caught, but you might as well beat things with it.
text.297: Level 15 Sword. The petals of a wojack are extraordinarily pointy. You find that when you shove them into things, it hurts a lot.
text.747: Holding this item in your hand makes you crave sugar tremendously. Also, your limbs feel tingly.
text.33: Now you can enjoy the sweet scent of baconweed ALL THE TIME! Grants 0.25% HP regeneration every second!
text.151: It has one slimy appendage that occasionally pokes out from its shell to probe things... And it smells like potpourri.
text.309: If you strategically place this stuffed Glutterfly somewhere, it would look creepy.
text.723: Magellan it up in the Tundra with this fashionable sign!
text.984: It's so hot, you get sweaty just from thinking about it. Then again, you get sweaty for no reason. Boosts your fire damage by 30%.
text.173: Level 9 chestplate. It protects your sternum from pokes, and it looks fabulous, too!
text.321: This floor makes an awkward squishing noise as you rub your toes against it, but it feels nice.
text.571: They say the safest part of a raging inferno is the point of origin. That's probably not true, but it couldn't hurt to test it. Burns enemies for 100% of your DPS!
text.816: It's spongy, yet bouncy, like the skin of some larvae stitched together. Because that's what it is.
text.44: A resilient flooring for those with finer taste.
text.163: There's nothing quite like the smell of burning in the any time of day or night. Deals 100% of your DPS as fire damage in an area.
text.349: By slapping this pump onto a Thrombyte, you can extract whatever goodness lies inside!
text.515: Tier 5 pickaxe. Be careful not to poke your parts with the spiky ball part of the pick.
text.776: It's perfectly shaped to fit in the mouth of a Glaser! Embiggens your Glaser to EPIC SIZE!
text.185: A shoddily-built teleporter with a fairly medium range. Still, a few of these strung together should make for a nice teleporter network!
text.361: You may think you don't need to call down lightning from the heavens... BUT YOU DO. 3% chance to shock enemies upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.619: While being carried, the egg makes high-pitched gurgling noises.
text.864: Be sure to point the fireworks end away from your parts.
text.41: Level 1 weapon. A sword made of grass. This will end well for you.
text.183: Dusk Crystals can withstand a tremendous amount of heat, which makes them perfect for CONTAINING TREMENDOUS AMOUNTS OF HEAT!
text.373: Level 29 Hammer. This fish has no skull. Instead, its stomach is in its head, and it swallows an exorbitant number of stones, which it keeps in its head-stomach to protect its tiny, tiny brain.
text.595: It might be good to build a few of these, in case you end up with a cruise ship in your possession.
text.856: This table is so sturdy it can hold at least five or six spaces.
text.205: The pods grown on this fork-shaped plant are full of an aromatic goo that burns like crazy when you rub it all over yourself.
text.688: The beak is so sharp you could cut paper with it, or styrofoam or something.
text.955: This gentle nappy will absorb the memory of a stabled pet's name, allowing you to rename the pet. Just tear open and use!
text.52: This reed is long and hollow. It's very resistant to bending, but it's not resistant to your charm and good looks. What up, reed?
text.195: Level 11 pants. They're pretty stiff, but you figure you'll make it work.
text.413: It demands that you bow before it and kiss its appendages.
text.648: With a pile of grenamel and a bit of TLC, you can hatch just about anything!
text.899: This high-tech door requires a high-tech key!
text.217: This large fragment of matter can be found firmly lodged in the flesh of the Bawg. Removing splinters seems to make the Bawg very happy.
text.425: Hewgodooko has some pretty big chests. This will come in handy for normal chest-based activities.
text.736: Being near this essence makes you want to barf. But... in a good way.
text.49: Hewgodooko left this lying around. What an idiot!
text.215: This fingery creature/plant repeatedly grows bulbous red pustules that taste a bit like cherries. It flinches when you pick them.
text.437: It's extremely well insulated, like styrofoam. It also feels like styrofoam. You wonder if it's styrofoam. It might just be styrofoam.
text.728: Putting this essence in your pocket makes you strangely attracted to Whistleroots.
text.979: When you flip the lid back, fire comes out! It's cutting edge technology! Boosts your fire damage by 20%.
text.237: Powering up your Thrombopump with a few components from the Bawg allows you to extract these tough fibers. Salty!
text.449: Torn from the chest cavity of a Gallum, this warp core might be useful for something involving warping.
text.560: Show your pet where to strike! Increases your pet's critical hit chance by 20%.
text.827: This came from somewhere... deep... And probably deals 300% of your DPS as physical damage!
text.60: Tables: you can put things on them, so long as you use a coaster.
text.227: The Snorble's uvula is a very delicate thing, because it contains the Snorble's third brain stem. It shies away from you when you try to poke it with a stick.
text.477: Be sure not to put your face in front of this while it's running, unless you're into horrifying spa treatments.
text.520: Level 33 Glove. It looks sharp on the outside, but it's even sharper on the inside. You should seek medical attention.
text.771: Used by the most powerful Throaks to hunt prey, or something like that. Embiggens your Throak to EPIC SIZE!
text.249: The legendary moustache of a Bamli. When you peer into it, you can see your own soul reflected back at you.
text.489: Level 27 Pants. The stranglers keep all your parts packed in tight!
text.608: If this hit you in the face at a high speed, it would be hilarious.
text.875: It will provide a good night's sleep, but you might need five showers in the morning.
text.57: The heart continues pumping long after it has been torn from its host. Interesting and morbid!
text.247: This little pod can be jammed into the flesh of the Bawg to grow new Nurva. It's odd when you think about it, so you stop thinking about it.
text.501: Level 29 Axe. When swung hard enough, ice skates can become deadly weapons. Like most things, probably.
text.600: It rocks back and forth, staring at you with wide eyes. Looking at it makes you uncomfortable.
text.851: It keeps your ship pointed in the right direction using space magnets!
text.75: Chop down sawgrass, logtrees, and whistleroot. WITH THE POWER OF VIOLENCE! Breaks apart Sawgrass, Logtrees, and Whistleroots!
text.266: This thing was burrowed deep inside a giant hair. It makes you feel itchy just looking at it.
text.685: Your hair stands on end as you walk past it. It's either the static or the creepiness.
text.934: A chunk of the legendary Lens. You wonder what would happen if all the pieces came together...
text.76: Doors make better doors than walls.
text.278: Tier 2 fishing pole. This pole is made of the most resilient materials of the Bawg, so it should DEFINITELY be able to stand up to a little bit of acid.
text.661: It's a squishy pile of organic goopy chunk part pieces. It's warm!
text.926: The ideal way to catch something that loves... GOOOOLD!
text.65: It's about time you went green with your lighting.
text.765: Glidopus be trippin. Embiggens your Glidopus to EPIC SIZE!
text.70: This would be even more useful if you had a gun.
text.318: Level 13 Helm. You think this hat makes you look super awesome. You might be right about that, but you might not.
text.709: This thingamabob will punch a hole in Furdle Frost, digging a permanent Geysir!
text.974: Standing on this will push you SUPER FAST! To the west!
text.91: Level 5 chestplate. Big shoulders make you more impressive in meetings and on the go.
text.330: Level 15 Pants. The insides of these slippers are... slippery. When you walk, it sounds like someone chewing a mouthful of mayonnaise.
text.557: This bat will give you all the leverage you need! 75% chance to hit nearby identical resources when harvesting.
text.806: Probably the fluffiest, bluffiest creature bed on the entire planet. Aside from the fluffy warmth of your love, that is.
text.92: Level 5 boots. Somehow you feel your knitting recipe flew off the rails.
text.342: Level 21 Helm. The sharp corners of this facemask constantly poke you in the eyes, but it's a sacrifice you have to make for fashion.
text.533: Gulantis love hide and seek. Maybe this little trick will scare one! Embiggens your Gulanti to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.798: Take your Squee gardening to the next level. LEVEL UP! SQUEEEEE! Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.81: Only the most fashionable and wealthy survivors can afford the luxury of Gem Lamps.
text.354: Level 23 Helm. What's better than having a hairy face? Having a hair-barky face.
text.637: Tartil eggs stick to everything they touch. INCLUDING THIS!
text.886: AWWWW WOOK AT ITS WIDDLE FACES! WWWOOOOOWOOWOOO!
text.86: Playing with leathery balls has been a pastime of your people for millennia. Why break with tradition?
text.382: The bags are probably full of helium or something. It floats gently above the waters of the Tundra.
text.581: It's so shiny you can see your reflection in it! That must be useful, somehow.
text.846: This is useful for making sure you stay in space!
text.107: When you squeeze it, a milky substance comes out. When you lick the milky substance, you are filled with regret.
text.394: It's so soft, you figure the thread count on this thing is in the jillions. It would make a nice bed... or coat.
text.678: For when you need to bathe the world in a delicious purpley glow.
text.941: These little guys seem to endlessly reproduce through mitosis. Every 20 seconds, a new Bubbly appears and follows you. If it gets close to an enemy, it will explode for 200% of your dps!
text.108: An extremely potent and versatile energy source!
text.406: Flungi use these roots to keep themselves aloft somehow. It seems like magic, so it probably is, according to Occam's razor.
text.670: Jamming this into the ground will cause a spur to appear over time. Gross, but effective.
text.917: It doesn't have even a glimmer of life left in its bones.
text.97: If you find an important critter, slap this bad boy down as a reminder.
text.418: This mossy stuff must do something to produce the pipes you always see protruding from it. BUT WHAT? Science will never know.
text.758: It won't stop vibrating. You can think of one good use for this. CALF MASSAGES!
text.102: This crystal looks totally awesome, and tastes salty sweet. It's possible that it's made of sugar. Or salt. They look very similar.
text.446: The skin is quite thin, but it's covered in an incredibly thick mat of fur. So thick, in fact, that it might not be fur at all. It might just be more skin.
text.718: Creates a powerful poison cloud that poisons LITERALLY EVERYTHING except for some stuff! Deals 300% of your DPS as poison damage!
text.965: For when you need to blind your house guests!
text.123: This cocoon was found inside a Squee plant. It jiggles and bounces to the sound of music.
text.458: When you gaze upon the lustrous sheen of the shell, you begin to hallucinate that you are stranded alone on a planet, fighting for your survival while trying to defeat a limbless alien.
text.550: This thing is shockingly good at shocking the socks off of things. Don't lick the tip. Grants a 10% chance on melee attack to deal electric damage!
text.813: For when fat beats just aren't appropriate.
text.124: This plant has no roots, but the bottom is extremely sticky and hard to detach from things once it latches on.
text.470: If you put a piece of bread into it, you would end up with more pieces of bread.
text.542: Now with firmified grippy handles XTREME! 360 noscope resource harvesting YOLO! Grants a 15% chance when breaking resources to gain a turbo run speed boost.
text.789: It takes a lot of LUNG POWER to keep this thing inflated. Inflabed. In... Infilgrated.
text.113: Legend says if you leave a potted baconweed by your back step, the baconweed fairy will steal your teeth. But that's silly... isn't it?
text.482: With this much protein, you could seriously consider getting into squats. Restores 17,894 HP.
text.630: The egg is covered in a sticky substance, and it smells like the bathroom of a bar at closing time.
text.893: Shows the cutscene of the escape pod launching from the exploding BS SS Assess
text.118: It's covered with bumps that ooze a putrid substance when popped. Still, as with bubble wrap, it's hard to resist.
text.510: Lyffs are super playful, so this toy-ish baubley thing should win one over pretty easily. Embiggens your Lyff to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.590: It's tough. It's rugged. It's the all new Karboan Door, straight from your very own Tumbler!
text.837: Why walk when you can BLIMP? Grants temporary flight for increased movement speed, and for traversing water!
text.10: Forming good relationships is all about putting up walls. Better get to work.
text.142: Level 7 helm. This complete covering will keep your head jelly intact.
text.263: Much like the bark of a tree, the bark of the Bawg's gigantic hairs is tough and dry. It appears to be flammable, but it would probably smell terrible to burn it.
text.695: OH GOD IT oh it's dead. Heh. For a minute there... ... anyways.
text.956: Turns out all you have to do is JAM IT IN THERE!
text.128: Picked from a Gassak plant, this bubbly sack smells strongly of methane.
text.283: This is how you talk with the Bureau of Shipping.
text.655: It's the perfect combination of soft, moist, and bone-crushingly firm!
text.900: This high-tech key probably goes into a high-tech door!
text.154: The local creatures are fascinated by this little plant.
text.303: This leathery pillow will really tie the room together!
text.743: Being near this essence makes your head feel tiny.
text.148: It seems to be giving you the evil eye.
text.307: After spending so much time around wompits, you're able to perfectly recreate a Wompit using your skills of taxidermy!
text.980: It's finely tuned to the Juice Frequencies of Woanope! Boosts your electric damage by 20%.
text.8: Delicious and healthy, the Wompirrito is a local culinary classic.
text.174: Level 11 legendary weapon. A lot of time, love, blood, sweat, and amber went into this. WORTH IT.
text.327: Level 17 Glove. The tentacles respond to your movements and make you feel way stronger and 30% more awesome.
text.567: It'll do tremendous damage to your enemies and make them bleed, but be careful catching it on the way back, or you might lose... a finger. Applies a bleed to enemies for 100% of your DPS.
text.828: It vibrates and pulses with squooshy mucus!
text.160: Set everyone and everything on fire! Why? SHUT UP! Deals 200% of your DPS as a mixture of fire and physical damage.
text.347: Snorbles are very safety-conscious; it's why they evolved giant airbags all over their bodies. Embiggens your Snorble to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.527: It runs pretty hot, but not very fast. You could probably beat it in a marathon, or with a stick.
text.772: Great for testing airbags and safety features! Embiggens your Snorble to EPIC SIZE!
text.186: Zugs are attracted by the allure of anything electrical. This Tesla ball is sure to impress! Embiggens your Zug to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.367: The water inside overflows until it freezes over, creating a sort of cap. One the frozen cap is in place, the Geysir builds up tremendous pressure inside that is only relieved when the cap is removed.
text.615: It stares into the soul of everything in the universe.
text.876: Looking at this clock, you can't tell what time it is.
text.180: Zugs have incredibly sophisticated kneecaps, rivaling the technology of a whole bunch of other stuff, like human kneecaps.
text.371: This snail-like beasty lives around boiling hot-water vents deep in the bottom of the ocean. It shivers nonstop as soon as you pull it out of the water.
text.852: There's something GOOFY about the sack of this Gassak gas sack sack. BETTER THROW IT AT SOMETHING FOR 175% OF YOUR DPS AS FIRE DAMAGE!
text.14: A blade of sawgrass. When you rub your hand across it, you bleed profusely. But when you rub your hand across it a SECOND time, you continue to bleed profusely.
text.206: Although it looks like a plant, the Artree is definitely connected to the vascular system of the Bawg.
text.391: Orange goo that has seeped up through the cracks in the green crystals of the Tundra. It has since hardened... And it smells like squid.
text.700: The power of Flungus keeps this glowing Icequill hovering gently in the air!
text.951: It's kind of a big deal.
text.192: Level 11 weapon. Dusk Crystals are extremely sharp when broken up into pieces. Makes for a great STAB!
text.411: It's packed full of nutrients, like fat, cholesterol, and various poisons! It also seems to be glaring at you.
text.644: Be sure to put the egg in right-side up, or you'll end up with an upside-down Glaser.
text.911: When the bottle touches your lips, you feel all tingly in your jibblies. 3% chance to gain turbo speed upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.218: This little growth is absolutely bursting with fruity flavors. MMMMM! Restores 591 HP.
text.431: The color of this lantern is similar to the prison garb of inmates back home on Earth. Those were the days.
text.212: Nurva are the dendrites of neurons that have somehow managed to protrude from the flesh of the Bawg. They crackle with electricity!
text.435: It's pointy and hums with energy. You wonder how it would feel to get poked by it.
text.724: Holding this object in your hand makes you feel... stompy.
text.12: This grass is super sharp and firm, yet flexible. And it tastes somewhat like lightly toasted marshmallows with a smattering of beef.
text.238: This little creature grows out of the enlarged pores of the Bawg. It doesn't seem happy to be removed from its home, but you obviously don't care.
text.455: Gulantis probably use these serrated edges to tear the meat from the bones of their innocent victims, or possibly for carpentry.
text.572: Draws a laser between you and your pet, which you can drag across enemies to damage them for 75% of your DPS.
text.823: When flung with the right wrist-flick, this will magnetically explode fish out of all fishing holes caught in its radius!
text.224: When you squeeze it, it lets out a dramatically loud, fart-like sound. This would work well for pranks, if you weren't the only human on this entire planet.
text.475: Level 25 Pants. The blubber does a great job of trapping the natural heat of your spicy legs, which is pretty important in the cold of the Tundra.
text.516: Pump it up and process it down! This bad boy will turn all that bubblin' crude into whatever your little heart desires!
text.783: Is this bed any better than any other bed? Does it matter? Why are we here? Is there a point to existence, or are we all just a cosmic accident?
text.250: You removed this horn forcibly from a Bamli's head. It was pretty horrifying. You're a monster.
text.495: This was covered in some Geysir Slurry, and you managed to clean it up. It's pretty rough around the edges, but it might be good for something.
text.620: No matter how much you dab it with paper towels, it remains perpetually moist.
text.871: Legends say if you put enough of these in your house, people will like you a lot less.
text.244: The long, slender axon of a Nurva. It conducts electricity really well, but it's terrible at baking cakes.
text.499: Fully equipped for all your tumbling needs, this Tumbler even comes with a cupholder! In the sense that you can put a cup near it.
text.596: This is where you keep all the books you tell everyone you've read!
text.863: Fingerpainting would never be relevant, your mother always told you. Show her she was WRONG!
text.21: What a convenient way to shape rocks into other shapes!
text.268: You were able to break this off of a spur. It's a very tough, shell-like thing, and it's super shiny. It would look cool to have a car made of this.
text.673: It's important to have a place from which to shout others down.
text.938: Level 37 Helm. Made from the finest space materials, this helm can protect your head parts from just about anything!
text.272: Is it a tooth, claw, horn, or flower petal? The world may never know. But it smells delightful.
text.665: It'll get all kinds of jibblies out of your blood tubes!
text.914: Tossing this sweet little thing into the acid of the Bawg will attract a new school of fish!
text.753: This makes you feel terrible about yourself.
text.312: It's possible that sitting on this chair will cause certain parts of your body to become radioactive. RADIOACTIVELY AWESOME, THAT IS.
text.713: It makes you feel things when you feel it.
text.962: You'd think it would be soft and silky, and IT DEFINITELY IS.
text.17: A round piece of wood, harvested from the Logtree plant. You've never seen anything like this!
text.332: Level 15 Glove. With the power of Wojack Suckers, you can hold on to just about anything!
text.545: It's time to take a huge crit all over the place! Increases your critical strike damage by 25%.
text.810: Gotta keep those babies nice and sharp.
text.336: Young Throaks often lose control of their tentacles. But not with THIS! Embiggens your Throak to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.537: All you need is the right attitude, a bit of elbow grease, and an elaborate workstation made of the skin of giant inflatable aliens.
text.786: It's so well insulated, it'd be nearly impossible to be tased in the butt while sitting in it.
text.356: Level 23 Glove. Grenamel makes for amazing arm protection, so long as you don't care about using your elbows, fingers, or anything else.
text.625: The baby Shirk inside screeches violently.
text.890: While this item is present on screen, explosions everywhere!
text.376: When squeezed, it emits a horrible odor. You also hear rumbling sounds nearby. Restores 7,268 HP.
text.585: Made of the toughest flatstone around, this door will keep all your stuff safe from burglars!
text.834: It loves your face so much it's sickening.
text.29: Level 1 chestplate. Cover your bosom with this amazing pile of boards to protect your ribs from slight bruising!
text.396: This weighs from three to twelve hundred pounds or kilograms. Or grams. It's very squirmy, so it's tough to get a read on it.
text.682: It's still warm to the touch, even after being stuffed!
