text.929: Her horribleness will no longer strike fear into the hearts of... well, pretty much anyone!
text.400: The blackbark of a Flailtree is much stronger and more resilient than its backbark.
text.658: It smells like something that died that ate something that also died after living a full life. Sends your pet into a berserking rampage for 3 minutes!
text.921: Because the Baconweed Fairy was too beautiful to be forgotten.
text.420: When scrubbed down, this ball of crud yields a cornucopia of precious metals!
text.762: Majestically transports you to the Tundra LIKE A SOARING EAGOLE!
text.440: It probably hurt when this was ripped from a Shirk's face, but Shirks probably don't have emotions or self-awareness, so it's not that big of a deal.
text.706: Infinite sponges? INFINITE SPONGES! SPONGE SPONGE SPONGE SPONGE. Sponge.
text.969: Standing on this will push you! To the east!
text.25: Signs are great at marking stuff on the map, but they aren't great at dodgeball.
text.460: Slurbs probably use these to amplify their aerobatic spins. This magnet has impeccable craftsmanship.
text.554: The smell reminds you of a frat party you went to once. But it'll increase the number of fish in schools by 40%, which is nice.
text.801: This baby will put hair into everything's chest. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.464: Pulled from a blast tube of a domesticated Blastcrab, this compound makes your breath flammable!
text.530: Level 35 Chest. It grips your ribs with the strength of a thousand dung beetles!
text.793: Not actually suitable for use on lawns. Chair not liable for serious injury or death.
text.634: It crackles with electricity. You get tiny static shocks the whole time you're holding it.
text.881: There's a hole in the top, so you can put your insanely huge piles of cash in there!
text.504: Level 29 Glove. Poofy shoulderpads are IN! Fashion is cyclical, right? ... Right?
text.578: It's pretty hard to walk on, on account of it being made of huge balls. But hey, it's the price you pay to walk on huge balls.
text.841: With the knowledge contained in this Spacetime Folder, you can fold spacetime to teleport yourself in battle!
text.38: This looks heavy. Turns out, it is.
text.139: Level 7 chestplate. Sometimes you feel like a stud. This is one of those times.
text.269: You managed to tear this off the foundation of a Spur before you destroyed it. Kind of like a dentist.
text.675: Write your name and put it in the bucket. It's definitely not a shredder or anything.
text.936: Will and Brad abandon Flux on Woanope!
text.133: If you treat a domesticated Glidopus well, it will give you its firstborn. And every born after that.
text.273: This came out of a domesticated Wojacks's... spice... organ. When you sniff it, your eyes change color.
text.667: Prodding this shrine makes your toes feel all twinkly toesy mctwinkle.
text.912: Spood Beasts have never been more tasty! Improves run speed by 5%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.35: These pretty flowers have a tantalizing aroma. Restores 81 HP.
text.159: Tough as snails and extremely shiny. You can think of some attractive people back home who wouldn't mind having some of this.
text.293: The engines that power the B.S. S.S. Assess.
text.755: When you lick it, you like it.
text.145: Level 8 weapon. With the power of ancient fossils and super sharp beaks, MOSTLY NOTHING CAN STOP YOU!
text.313: It took a lot of walker blossoms to make this, but you reassure yourself that it was totally worth it somehow.
text.715: Harness the explosive power of BABIES! Er... vompoles. Not babies. Deals 250% of your DPS as physical damage!
text.960: You can feel poison residue soaking into your feet while you walk on it. It's nice!
text.46: Pouring this along the murdery part of your weapon makes it RED-HOT! 3% chance to set enemies on fire upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.171: Level 9 boots. Their shiny sheen really brings out the definition in your thighs.
text.333: By weaving together all kinds of spindly, slimy organs and things, you've managed to create quite the impeccable workstation!
text.547: You'll be the life of any party with this fancy Rave Tube! Unless you're a cop. Grants a 5% chance on melee attack to gain a turbo speed boost.
text.808: A fragment of the horn of the ancient and mysterious Megalari. The Polari believe it has MAGICAL PROPERTIES!
text.165: Rub this bad boy all over your tender skin! It'll clear up 1,378 burn damage.
text.337: Although they look disgusting, Wojacks are obsessed with cleanliness! Embiggens your Wojack to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.539: It's only after you've burned everything that you're free to do anything. Grants a 10% chance to set enemies on fire.
text.784: This would be softer if you did more squats. But then, the whole world would be softer, WOULDN'T IT?
text.43: It can handle a lot of stress and weight, but it can't handle criticism.
text.191: It's one of the toughest and rarest materials in the Savanna. So... what better way to use a Dusk Crystal than to WALK ALL OVER IT?
text.627: It squishes like an airbag. It's almost as if there's nothing inside it...
text.177: A fine place for a quick snooze. Legends say that while you're asleep, all of your health is restored.
text.377: Instead of leaves, this plant grows a crazy amount of hair. The hair generates energy for the plant by blowing in the wind. It reminds you of one of your distant relatives.
text.587: This door probably couldn't do much to keep anything out, but it sure feels great!
text.832: Some ancient civilization must have put this together. The parts are SUPER INTRICATE!
text.54: Glidopi keep their ink in glass bottles for safety. A gasoline-like aroma fills the air when you pop the cork.
text.203: Your pets will love the spicy deliciousness so much, they'll go into a murderous rampage! 10% pet damage boost for 20 minutes.
text.397: This trunk sure can take a pounding.
text.680: This beautiful piece will keep your other beautiful pieces marginally visible at night.
text.931: If it comes back, you'll just have to STAB IT AGAIN! AND AGAIN! AND AGAIN AND AGAIN. AND AGAIN. AND... AGAIN.
text.197: These crystalline walls are very... ACOUSTIC. You can hear your own voice echoing back when you're near them.
text.401: The seed of a Flailtree. It's very aggressive and disagreeable. Better to bury it and get it over with.
text.923: This delicious brew warms the very cockles of your soul. Reduces ice damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.51: This termite-like creature is attracted to the sounds of Whistleroot plants. Its jaws are razor-sharp, but it refuses to bite you.
text.223: Although Satgats have very hard shells, their flesh is soft and tender. Like a clam, only more adorable.
text.421: This little weirdo can move REALLY fast. When it wants to. Which it doesn't. YOU CAN'T TELL IT WHAT TO DO.
text.760: This essence makes you want to SING TO THE HEAVENS WITH YOUR GLORIOUS BLOWHOLE!
text.209: This parasitic creature feeds on the life force of the Bawg. TIME FOR PAYBACK! Restores 2,234 HP when eaten.
text.441: You managed to squeeze this whopping sodium chunk out of a domesticated Shirk's salt gland. And you only nearly lost a limb!
text.704: Once potted, Boreoles stop glowing. Must be something about... sciencey crap...
text.971: Standing on this will push you SUPER FAST! To the north!
text.62: It's sticky, like glue should be.
text.235: This tiny Jollychomp appears to be a baby. They must somehow lose their eyes when they reach adulthood. This makes no sense, but it must work for them.
text.461: It's so insanely pointy, you could probably attach it to something, then poke stuff with that thing, and it would hurt a lot.
text.552: One foot on the ground, and the other on the grounder. Grants 20% electric damage resistance.
text.803: GRASP AHOY! Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.229: This ball of goo was extracted from the body of a domesticated Throak. It wobbles perpetually without stopping!
text.465: It's tough and chewy! Almost too chewy...
text.528: Level 35 Axe. It's heavy, awkward, pointy, and dangerous. Just like your ex-spouse.
text.795: The slightest poke would cause it to rupture, possibly with force of up to millions of tons of dynamite.
text.59: If you had knees, this would be a good place to sit. But still... nice to look at.
text.255: Domesticated Vomma produce these tasty balls of gelatin on a regular basis. They remind you a lot of tapioka.
text.485: You can plant seeds in it! It's so furdle and durty!.
text.632: It's covered in suckers! Probably to keep it attached to... whatever.
text.883: Definitely one of the worst surfaces you've walked on, but what the HECK?
text.241: The acid of the Bawg has purified the healing essence of this Fathead. Restores 2,234 HP!
text.505: Level 29 Pants. Sloots with the fur, to protect your beautiful calves from the biting cold.
text.576: It seems very resilient, almost as if you could smash it repeatedly with a blossom to no effect.
text.843: It got caught in a Geysir vent and pulled from the underworld. KILL IT!
text.72: Nothing's sharper than sawgrass... except maybe a sawgrass seed flying into your eye. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.262: After prying this from the clutches of a vicious Blegh, you are able to examine it up-close. You have concluded that it is bumpy.
text.693: It looks just like the real thing! A dead version of the real thing, anyway.
text.958: By whipping some Clossoms around, you can slap potted plants right out of their pots! Insta-harvests all adjacent potted plants.
text.79: This pump will produce an endless supply of water balloons when placed in Savanna water.
text.282: It's a wall from your ship!
text.653: What if the Wojack egg DIGS THROUGH THE INCUBATOR?
text.902: This invisible item will override the normal music with BATTLE MUSIC while it's present on screen!
text.66: It seems to glow brighter in higher densities. Poking your finger into it burns and tingles at the same time.
text.302: For some reason, Bamlis have an unnatural obsession with anything shaped like a bucket. Embiggens your Bamli to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.741: It feels very light, as if it's full of air! Wait. That's just gas.
text.69: Level 3 gloves. Nothing warms your hands up like the skin of animals!
text.306: You get a sense that having this pillow around will make you feel ultra hip, or whatever the kids are saying these days.
text.733: Coming near this essence makes you want to poke things with your long, creepy fingers.
text.982: Legends say if you wield the power of Plagoo, you should wear extra deodorant. Boosts your poison damage by 30%.
text.88: A hefty suck'n'blow will get you to where you want to go! Assuming where you want to go is POISONING YOUR ENEMIES FOR 100% OF YOUR DPS!
text.326: Level 17 Chest. The suckers of the Throak tentacles constantly give you backrubs. It's nice.
text.565: Whacking an enemy with this thing will poison it and everyone and everything it loves! Deals 100% of your DPS as poison damage to your target and nearby targets.
text.830: Level 37 Axe. This beast will make you the envy of every angler IN THE WHOLE DANG WORLD!
text.95: These plants look like they're trying to escape, but they're not fooling anyone.
text.346: When cooked ever so slightly, Fatheads produce a delicious juice that restores 1,609 HP.
text.525: Tier 4 trowel. The grip is pretty slippery, but it should get the job done.
text.774: Are these cage-fed? Embiggens your Bamli to EPIC SIZE!
text.82: If you hold it up to your eye and squint really hard, you become self conscious and immediately stop.
text.366: The flower of this plant is insanely heavy. The blossom climbs up the stalk, then smashes down into the ice to break off chunks, which the plant then consumes.
text.613: It floats in the water, despite being made of ultra-dense materials. There must be some science in there!
text.878: Excuse me, sir... your ball is glowing.
text.85: OH GOD IT'S SO COLD WHY IS IT SO COLD GET IT AWAY. Reduces fire damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.370: A hairy squid, well-suited for swimming in the extreme cold of the Tundra. It seems highly intelligent.
text.605: A shoot of Maarla that has burst through a flatstone boulder.
text.854: Keep it lubey in here, or you'll get stuck.
text.104: This is the byproduct of your weak attempts at harvesting dusk shards. If you suck it into your nose, it makes your pupils dilate.
text.390: It glows between a range of colors to lure in its prey. When the target gets close, it sits there and does nothing, because it's a mushroom.
text.702: These perps will add ambience to any room that doesn't already have Perps in it!
text.949: Shows the credits for the game.
text.111: This will go STRAIGHT to your thighs.
text.410: It's wet and sticky, like the goop that comes out of an egg. Oh, wait... that's EXACTLY WHAT IT IS.
text.646: You know what makes for great padding? Giant, squirming larvae.
text.909: Pouring this steamy blend onto your weapon will cripple your enemies! 3% chance to poison enemies upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.98: Need to remember the location of something wet and slippery? Use this!
text.430: THIS HEWGOLANTERN IS MAGENTAMAAAAAZING! It's magenta.
text.750: Holding this essence makes you feel like shooting laser beams from your forehead!
text.101: Tier 2 saw. The serrated Blastique edges of this saw will tear through Squee plants like a knife through something soft and buttery!
text.434: Extracted from a domesticated Glaser, it works well to keep things tied up. Might as well not question a good thing.
text.726: Gazing upon this amazing whatever it is, you feel compelled to amputate one of your legs and hop around wildly.
text.120: Show your dinner guests your hard side with this solid stone table.
text.454: It gets warm when you hold fire to it, but it stops getting warm when you take the fire away.
text.574: It's velvety and soft, like soft velvet. Rubbing your head on it makes you feel relaxed.
text.821: For when you need to chop things, but don't want to chop things! Breaks apart all Mk3 resources, plus Artrees, Bone Spurs, Bawg Hairs, Furgrasps, Spireggs, and Smashblossoms!
text.127: A small and fragile plant with a single bulb. Even though it's just a plant, it seems terrified of everything.
text.474: Level 25 Glove. The yolk is pretty sticky, but it keeps the gloves firmly cemented onto your hands. It's a trade-off.
text.518: Level 33 Helm. It's just heavy enough that you might break your neck wearing it. That's how you know it's good.
text.781: BE SELF-CONSCIOUS OF YOUR RIBCAGE NO MORE! Embiggens your Gallum to EPIC SIZE!
text.114: With the right attitude, you can milk just about anything. This comes from a domesticated Wompit!
text.494: It seems that the slurry you get from geysirs might contain valuable resources. This station will let you extract all the delicious goodness!
text.622: The blowhole must be there for a reason. What that might be... nobody knows.
text.869: There's a hole in the bottom... you put your games in there.
text.117: A sticky ball of Tartil chunks. It tastes slightly of almonds and sweetened condensed milk. Slightly buttery. Would definitely make a great pound cake.
text.498: Tier 3 fishing pole. It's long, hard, and thorny. Like a fishing pole should be.
text.598: Touching this shrine makes your legs feel all tingly. Like that feeling when you sit on the toilet for too long, only different.
text.861: Settle in for some smooth jazz, baby.
text.136: You've carefully extracted this fur from the face of a Wat by stabbing it to death. It better be worth it!
text.267: Somehow, those giant spurs sticking out of the Bawg are able to develop gold chunks inside of them. You should investigate this further, for science.
text.687: Even though they are immobile and stuffed, its wings move so fast you cannot see them.
text.932: It was a tricky opponent, but not as tricky as you! OR WAS IT? Is this a trick? No, of course not. OR IS IT?
text.134: Wat kind of a wing, is this? Yes, it is a Wat kind of a wing. It never stops vibrating. Wat.
text.279: Tier 3 saw. The flora of the Bawg seem very resilient to your masterfully crafted Blastique saw, but this puppy should do the trick.
text.663: This RICH COMPOUND OF BLEH should work well for cultivating a Bawg garden!
text.924: It uses pure KRAKENERGY to pry open even the toughest of packages.
text.156: This perfect replica of a Glidopus should easily trick any reasonable Glidopus. Embiggens your Glidopus to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.291: He seems to be staring into your soul with his cold, lifeless eyes.
text.767: A growing Wat needs the warmth of a sleep sack! Embiggens your Wat to EPIC SIZE!
text.146: This flurry of fish is easily frightened.
text.319: Using the focused power of firmified Jolly Fulmar, you're able to finely craft things with such immense detail that it hurts your eye sockets just thinking about it.
text.711: When placed in the right environment, this will yield a DELICIOUS Smashblossom!
text.972: Standing on this will push you SUPER FAST! To the south!
text.168: Made from the finest fatheads, this potion will cure what ails you, so long as what ails you is near-death. Restores 638 HP.
text.331: Level 15 Chest. The constant flexing of the myelar makes it incredibly hard to breathe, yet you still feel compelled to wear it.
text.559: Now your pet's tiny arms can get some work done! Increases your pet's damage by 20%.
text.804: Be careful not to flay yourself when this bad boy goes off! Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.166: Rubbing this into your fleshy bod gives it a healthy glow! Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.343: Level 21 Chest. Although it looks bulky, it's actually quite light. It's even aerodynamic!
text.535: It can hold in a lot of heat, though it gets sticky after a lot of use. It could use a good rub-down from time to time.
text.796: Triangles are nature's most elegant wobbly shapes.
text.188: By combining a Dusk crystal with some other odds and ends, you've been able to seed the growth of a Dusk Crystal formation!
text.355: Level 23 Chest. Sometimes, you just gotta awesomely cover your entire torso in the forged bones of an ancient giant beast. This is one of those times.
text.639: This should keep a Wompit egg at just the right temperature to make it hatch!
text.884: Nothing says STAY OUT OF MY HOUSE better than this mat! Disclaimer: This mat does not speak.
text.178: It seems you can carefully pry the tough, outer shell off a Zug by stabbing it or beating it to death. SCIENCEY!
text.383: One of the walls from Hewgodooko's savanna fortresses. It's pretty dang durable.
text.583: It's tough enough to withstand a hurricane, but gentle enough that you could trust it to look after your kids.
text.844: It's rubbery, hot, and stretchy. It would make for a great coaster!
text.200: Be sure to keep it in a shady place! Ah, who am I kidding? There is no shade on this planet. Put it wherever you want.
text.395: This thing appears to be used to perform unspeakable acts of plant romance.
text.676: Sometimes the best ideas come from taking two random objects and cramming them together really hard.
text.943: It's the part of a ship that makes the ship not explode.
text.198: Square doors make for a better seal, but KEEP AN EYE OUT FOR YOUR SHINS.
text.407: Based on the size and complexity of his brain, Flungi may be the most intelligent creatures in the universe. Too bad they can't move or speak!
text.919: Is it REALLY the bottom if you flip it around? Yes, it is.
text.220: After being forcibly removed from a Satgat's body, the exoskeleton glows for a while and makes loud humming noises. It makes you very uncomfortable.
text.419: The intense pressures inside Geysirs are SO CRAZY HIGH, they can turn just about anything into a diamond! Including whatever this was!
text.756: IT'S SO DANG HOT. OOH OOWEE! HOT HOT HOT! SO HOT RIGHT NOW!
text.210: Whenever you stand near a Jollychomp with one of these tick-like creatures in hand, the Jollychomp seems very interested.
text.447: When a Lyff wants to go for a dip, this puppy keeps it afloat. It's so effective that Lyffs can't swim more than a foot or so underwater without popping back up.
text.716: If it bleeds, you can kill it. If it's already bleeding, you probably don't have to. Bleeds enemies for 250% of your DPS!
text.967: Standing on this will push you! To the south!
text.232: It seems to stay alive even when separated from the Throak's body. It's almost as if it's an entirely separate creature.
text.459: Acquired from a domesticated Slurb. Is it mucus? Is it electric? Yes.
text.548: You ain't got time to bleed, but your enemies sure do! Grants a 10% chance on melee attack to cause your target to bleed.
text.815: Sure, it's hard as a ball of concrete, and as heavy as one, but... You know.
text.230: This enlarged cell body contains a huge volume of chemicals that can be used to freeze things, slowing them down tremendously. If you lick it, your tongue freezes to it.
text.471: Level 25 Hammer. The plumage on the hilt really gives it a nice counterbalanced heft.
text.540: Imbue your attacks with THROAK TENTACLE POWERS! Grants a 10% chance on melee attack to deal ice damage.
text.791: This table is the flattest surface in the known universe. It's so flat, you could put a glass on it if you use a coaster.
text.252: The domesticated Bamli produces an excessive amount of this hormone. It's unclear what it's for.
text.483: This disgusting fluid makes you REALLY UPSET. 3% chance to go berserk upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.628: It gets stuck to your hand when you touch it. Hopefully it's not permanent.
text.895: This amazing device can power another amazing device for a short while!
text.242: Vampries attach themselves onto anything that dips its toe into the water. Their barbed teeth make them very difficult to pry off. Fortunately, they're ticklish.
text.511: Level 31 Helm. Wearing this cap infuses your cerebrum with the mental faculties of a Flungus. It also removes your depth perception, which is a plus.
text.588: The sun reflects off it in such a blindingly bright way, it's hard to even open the thing. How pretty!
text.839: Level 24 Hammer. Pulsatrating with the throbulent cardia of life, this hammer will kill everything.
text.256: This is where Vomma babies are made. You're not sure why you felt compelled to pick it up and carry it around.
text.697: When you gotta punch a wobbly picture of your nemesis, you gotta punch a wobbly picture of your nemesis.
text.946: It's unclear why the Bureau would send this unreliable prototype as a Package Rescue vehicle, but... there it is.
text.20: This workbench with a circular saw will allow you to craft all kinds of wooden masterpieces!
text.284: It's where you get your Whizbox!
text.641: Ever wanted a shrieking bird shark following you around? Now's your chance!
text.906: Pour this tasty concoction onto your weapon to give it a chance to cause bleeding! 3% chance to cause enemies to bleed upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.296: Level 13 Hammer. When combined with the power of Vlaps, Jollychomp parts make for an excellent beating device.
text.745: It tingles your toes when you poke it with your toes. Stop poking it with your toes.
text.308: This lifelike dead Glidopus will either spruce up your living room, or something resembling the exact opposite.
text.721: Fight the darkness with the bright glow of this AMAZING EMERALD TORCH! Order now and we'll throw in a bag of toothpaste.
text.320: Deploying this fake Vomma Baby Sack causes something magical to happen! Embiggens your Vomma to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.569: Fling balls of packed snow and ice at your enemies, dealing 70% of your DPS as ice damage and freezing all of their legs in the area!
text.818: It's pretty dang big, and it explodes pretty dang big, too! Flings out three other bombs, and also deals 100% of your DPS as physical damage.
text.16: A tough tendon from the leg of a Wompit. It's stretchy enough that you might be able to tie your hair up with it, if you weren't in a space suit.
text.348: Cramming a tasty Bleghpod full of nutritious Jolly Fulmar? AMAZING! Boosts your pet's critical strike chance by 15% for 20 minutes.
text.513: Level 31 Glove. Wrapping a Lyff tongue around your hand has augmented the sounds of your slaps to become very satisfying.
text.778: This lyff lifts, broh. Embiggens your Lyff to EPIC SIZE!
text.360: Let's be honest here; you're just throwing ingredients into a jar and seeing what sticks. Restores 2,221 HP.
text.617: It's hot to the touch. Like an egg, but one that's hot to the touch.
text.866: Follow the blubelights TO YOUR BLUBEY DESTINY!
text.372: Its bristles are soft. They remind you of the time you used to work as a maid and carried a featherduster around everywhere you went.
text.593: There is KNOWLEDGE inside this box!
text.858: This milkshake will bring all the birds to the yard.
text.384: One of Hewgodooko's control consoles. It's connected to something much larger than itself.
text.690: It takes a lot of work to keep these airbags inflated, but it pays the mortgage.
text.953: If this item is present on-screen, the character will be forced to teleport to the Tundra upon death.
text.28: Level 1 boots. They'll keep your feet warm in the cold weather! Well, kinda. Not really. They're wood.
text.412: This shell is one of the hardest substances you've seen since you began looking at it just a second ago.
text.650: With the right amount of blube, you can fit a Snorble egg into just about anything.
text.897: Great for communicating with the Bureau of Shipping! And probably other Bureaus also?
text.424: This lamp glows with infinite fuel, probably using some kind of mystical energy source known only to... whatever Hewgodooko is.
text.738: You feel that if you were to touch it, you would be stung. Only one way to find out!
text.436: When a Glaser eats something unusual, its stomachs tie in knots. This seems like a disadvantage.
text.730: This makes you feel sticky, yet delicious. Like some kind of sticky cake or dessert.
text.977: This machine should allow you to harness the power of Crystallized Juice so you can modify your equipment!
text.448: It's coarse and covered in bumps. If you rub it on your cheek, nothing happens.
text.562: One look at this horrible thing will get that adrenaline pumping! Provides a turbo speed boost for 10 seconds.
text.825: This little guy will help you tell whether the wind is blowing! Hint: it is.
text.24: Use it to pry up floors you have placed! Just equip it and poke the floor you want to pry. Or don't; it's up to you, really.
text.476: It's a patchy job, but most Shirks are just dumb enough to fall for it. Embiggens your Shirk to POWERFUL SIZE!
text.522: Level 33 Sword. Look at this sword. You could poke the whole world with this thing.
text.769: You've never puked until you've puked through one of these babies. Embiggens your Vomma to EPIC SIZE!
text.488: Level 27 Sword. Although Glaser stomachs don't make for very good building components, they work much better once you stab them with everything else.
text.610: It's straddlebark in a pot. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT?
text.873: Definitely less maintenance than a non-grenamel dog sculpture.
text.500: It smells like waffles without syrup. Reduces physical damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.
text.602: A bud of the giant plant called Maarla. The petals glow with a radiant orange.
text.849: Slapping this will suck you through space and drop you RIGHT SMACK in the Savanna!
